PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 296, 363, 312]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 276, 905, 291]]<|/det|> 9702/31 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 297, 905, 312]]<|/det|> May/June 2017 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 318, 905, 333]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 358, 584, 374]]<|/det|> Additional Materials: As listed in the Confidential Instructions. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 389, 388, 406]]<|/det|> ## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 415, 718, 431]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 320, 446]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|> DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 273, 515]]<|/det|> Answer both questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 780, 530]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of one hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 905, 560]]<|/det|> You are expected to record all your observations as soon as these observations are made, and to plan the presentation of the records so that it is not necessary to make a fair copy of them. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 740, 574]]<|/det|> You are reminded of the need for good English and clear presentation in your answers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 358, 599]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 767, 614]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 624, 806, 640]]<|/det|> Additional answer paper and graph paper should be used only if it becomes necessary to do so. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 604, 665]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 758, 680]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 718, 905, 848]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 779, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the motion of oscillating table tennis balls.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 144, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
Tape each ball to a length of string. Ensure the total length of the string and ball is \(35.0 \text{cm}\), as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 175, 806, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 303, 534, 320]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 349, 146, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 349, 180, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 349, 544, 368]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 378, 672, 730]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 749, 534, 767]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 72, 181, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 675, 89]]<|/det|>
Pull one of the balls towards you through a short distance.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 771, 120]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[527, 195, 873, 212]]<|/det|>
<form>time = .................................................. $s$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 227, 403, 244]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[527, 318, 875, 336]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 365, 616, 384]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 412, 724, 430]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 655, 383, 673]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 257, 546, 275]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 644, 181, 662]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 644, 428, 662]]<|/det|>
Pull both balls towards you.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 674, 698, 692]]<|/det|>
Release the balls at the same time and watch the movement.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 689, 792, 707]]<|/det|>
The two balls will move backwards and forwards becoming out of phase.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 704, 843, 722]]<|/det|>
After a time they will be back in phase so that they move towards you together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 720, 757, 737]]<|/det|>
The ball with the block attached completes \(n\) oscillations in this time.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 143, 91]]<|/det|>
